title: Understanding Le Chatelier's Principle
text: Le Chatelier's Principle states that if a dynamic equilibrium is disturbed by changing the conditions, the position of equilibrium shifts to counteract the change and restore equilibrium.

title: Effect of Adding Reactants
text: When more of a reactant is added to a system at equilibrium, the system will shift to reduce the concentration of the added reactant. This usually means the equilibrium will shift towards the products.

title: Direction of Equilibrium Shift
text: In the reaction CO2(g)+H2(g)⇌CO(g)+H2O(g), adding more CO2 will increase the concentration of CO2. According to Le Chatelier's Principle, the system will shift to the right to produce more CO and H2O.

title: Understanding Equilibrium Constant
text: The equilibrium constant Kp is a measure of the ratio of the concentrations of products to reactants at equilibrium. A large Kp value indicates that the products are favored at equilibrium.

title: Predicting the Outcome
text: Given that Kp is large (2.0×10**3), the system already favors the formation of products. Adding more CO2 will further shift the equilibrium to the right, increasing the concentrations of CO and H2O.
